title: Lesson A2-4 Assessment: SVO Sentence Structure Basics

questions.question: What does SVO stand for?
questions.explanation: SVO stands for Subject-Verb-Object, the basic sentence structure in both English and Georgian.

questions.question: What case do objects take in Georgian sentences?
questions.explanation: Objects in Georgian sentences take Dative case. Example: მე ვხედავ კატას (I see the cat), where კატას is Dative.

questions.question: What is the correct form of 'to see' for 'I see'?
questions.explanation: For 'I see', we use ვხედავ (vkhedav) with the ვ- prefix indicating first person.

questions.question: In the sentence 'მე ვაძლევ ბავშვს წიგნს' (I give the child a book), how many objects are there?
questions.explanation: The verb 'to give' takes two objects: ბავშვს (indirect object - to the child) and წიგნს (direct object - the book). Both are in Dative case.
